values.value: TBA is an unannounced project currently in progress that focuses to be an entire new "expansion" to Call of Duty: Black Ops 3. This expansion will be a standalone co-op gamemode, with a target of 4-6 players per a match. It will feature several new concepts that have yet to be explored in modding, and is developed with an internal API that will be usable by other users to enable us to promote custom maps for this expansion in the future.

This project will include ground-up, never before seen AI that will challenge how players think and play this game, and will also include lots of variety for the standardized enemy types to provide a comfortable gameplay mix-up and keep things fresh. The intention is to create something that is new and different, with lots of options that will provide players that have an itch to keep playing to try new ways to play and experiment. It will be accessible, but still challenging -- players may have to fail a level a few times before they can truly understand how to succeed if they're new to the game.

TBA is being developed by a team of four people, and will include brand new maps, a new weapon arsenal, new enemies, its own soundtrack, and lots of unique features all scripted from-scratch specifically for this expansion.

My responsibilities on this expansion include leading & directing the project from inception, developing & maintaining all gameplay script and code, developing all UI script and code, developing all of the AI behavior, and prototyping level design. I am currently working with a full team of Level Designers, Modelers, Animators, Audio Engineers and Graphics Designers.

content.title: PROJECT OVERVIEW
values: Extinction: Ground War was a rapid-prototype experiment in creating a new hybrid FPS-RTS gamemode on the Call of Duty engine. This was an exercise in system interactions and AI development that greatly strengthened my understanding of this type of development.

The gameplay loop of the mode involved collecting a currency called "DNA" by eliminating enemies in the field, then using that currency to create your own units that could then be commanded to attack other enemies and explore the field. Your unit options were expanded by creating varying structures, which also costed DNA.
Victory is achieved by defeating the other player's army entirely, then eliminating them.

content.title: MY CONTRIBUTION
values: Created basic level design blockouts to assist with rapid prototyping of gameplay and behaviors
Worked with a UI designer to implement their UI artwork into the gameplay loop
Designed and implemented AI behavior and interactions
Scripted the core gameplay management systems

detail.role: Gameplay Design, Technical UI Design, Scripter, AI Scripter

content.title: PROJECT OVERVIEW
values: Smash Ops was a PvP gamemode created for Black Ops 3 as another rapid prototype proof of concept.

The gamemode places players inside of arenas that are much smaller than the standard Call of Duty map size, and replaces the traditional shoot-and-die mechanics of Call of Duty with an implementation of a fighting game-style damage-knockback system.
Each of the game's built-in characters were re-purposed as loadouts, affecting the weapons and abilities the players could use during the game, all with different damage and knockback values.
The gamemode shipped with two sub-gamemodes: lives-based and time-based.

content.title: MY CONTRIBUTION
values: Balanced character weapon loadouts
Created a system that would convert the Call of Duty damage model into our custom one
Worked with a level designer to give them direction on balancing their level around the gamemode's mechanics
Scripted the core gameplay management systems

detail.role: Gameplay Design, Technical UI Design, Scripter

content.title: PROJECT OVERVIEW
values: Boss Rush was a PvE gamemode with the goal of diving into the understanding of the Havok AI systems provided with the CoD engine.
Players would work together to fight a single strong enemy AI, placed inside of controlled arenas designed around how each AI would behave.

AI were given distinct patterns that players could learn, but were still provided with small amounts of randomization to keep them on their feet. As the enemy's health would drop, new attacks were added to the pattern in order to keep the entire fight feeling fresh.

content.title: MY CONTRIBUTION
values: Designed & implemented AI and identified ways to improve their behavior to reduce or increase difficulty based on feedback
Gameplay UI implementation for the core HUD and the enemy health bars
Worked with an environment artist to ensure artistic input aligned with gameplay integrity
Created level designs that adhered to the behavior of each individual AI

detail.role: Gameplay Design, Technical UI Design, Scripter, Level Design, AI Scripting

content.title: PROJECT OVERVIEW

The website featured a variety of 360 degree looping videos that were designed to offer users a chance to experience a relaxing VR environment using something as simple as their phones.

Managed input and output from a MySQL database

content.title: PROJECT OVERVIEW
values: Mindshare was a Call of Duty Zombies fan-project modification. The goal of this project was to bolt on to an existing gamemode and change or add features to provide a varied experience.
This project didn't change the central gameplay flow of Zombies, but introduced a feature where players would complete 6 objectives to enable the power for certain interactables around the map.

Mindshare was my first venture into AI, but due to a limitation in the Black Ops engine, was actually a specially designed pseudo-AI, accomplishing the goal in the face of being unable to interface with the game's actual pre-compiled navmesh.

content.title: MY CONTRIBUTION
values: Worked with a UI designer to identify needed graphics and implemented them into the game.
Designed new features that changed the gameplay flow of the existing level design.
Created a dynamic pseudo-AI to make more dynamic encounters.

content.title: PROJECT OVERVIEW
values: CODWare was a PvP gamemode with the goal of creating a completely fresh arcade-like experience on the Black Ops 3 engine.

The gameplay loop had players going through a variety of randomly-sorted fast-pace minigames, called "microgames". These games would vary in activity, and would randomly sort players into teams or free-for-all alignment in order to accomplish their goal. With each minigame completed, the minigames would get faster paced.

Victory was achieved by having the highest score after 15 minigames, and a "boss minigame" were completed. To keep things fresh, "special rounds" were introduced that would change the rules of the game, such as flipping the victor to be the player with the lowest score.
An update was later introduced that added more minigames and added pseudo-AI functionalities to some minigames, using "Sonic the Hedgehog" themed fan content.

content.title: MY CONTRIBUTION
values: Worked with a level designer to create a map that would accomodate each minigame
Designed a variety of small minigames to keep the gameplay fresh through each loop
Identified & revised minigames that may have been to difficult or confusing for players
